page.title: 12BLACKBURN/PADIHAM LOOP LINE
page.content: The{Loop Line}took eleven years to build. It should have been completed by 1871 but due to the weather it was finally finished at the end of May 1877. Work carried on even though the Read and Simonstone residents objected. The line was opened to goods traffic on 1st June 1877 and to passengers on 15th October 1877. The line was mostly used by industry. Due to the lack of passengers the line was closed and the last train was on 3rd December 1877. The line carried coal to the power stations until November 1964. All that now remains of the railway is the raised embankment and some clinker but no sleepers or rails are left. The railway is now used as a footpath and the verges are overgrown with grass, flowers and trees.
